Posts.Content: Since my last post, I've met with surgeon, I should get operated between July 4th and 12th. Then go through 4 weeks of radiation.I cannot tell you how all this long waiting for exact diagnostic is having an effect on me.... I have a question, if I can make myself understandable, yesterday at the hopital I checked with the clerk who calls you to let you know your date of surgery and she told me that on my file I'm schedualed to have a harpoon put in my breast. I searched a little to know what this is, but with not much success. My doctor had told me he would take out sentinels nods and the cancerous calcifications and inject color in the breast. Never talked about harpoon. From what I read (only could find one or two places on internet that mentionned that word) it's a method of surgery. I was under the impression he was going to make an incision in the breast and take out the cancer calcif. On the other hand from the little I could find on the internet about harpoon it was not very clear but seemed to say it's a surgery done with help of monitor to guide the harpoon through an opening sort of like a laparascopie and at the same time taking out the tumor calcificartions again not really sure what it said. I wonder if this is safe, if they can find all the calcifications this way, and if it is the usual procedure.... all your comments would greatly be appreciated if any of you that reads this knows about procedures for removing calcifications, because I had a lump removed 20 years ago, not malignant but they did open my breast, thanks for your time and patience for reading such a long post.
Posts.Title: Harpoon?

Posts.Content: Robin,again so nice of you to answer my post, I have called the cancer society this morning, and got the answer I was looking for. It is a form of removal, where they put harpoon around the lump, before removing it, it is to localize it, and not as I previously thought to extract it. I fell reassure, because the clinics where closed for 4 days and I could not get my doctor and was worried about this form of procedure. Now that I understand better, I am more at peace. Have a nice day, and I will post again after surgery and final diagnostic........
